code: stns <- c("08NH130", "08NH005") runoff_data <- hy_daily_flows(station_number = stns, start_date = "2000-01-01") %>%   left_join(     hy_stations(station_number = stns) %>%       select(STATION_NUMBER, STATION_NAME, DRAINAGE_AREA_GROSS),     by = "STATION_NUMBER") %>%   ## conversion to mm/d   mutate(runoff = Value / DRAINAGE_AREA_GROSS * 86400 / 1e6 * 1e3)    ggplot(runoff_data) +    geom_line(aes(x = Date, y = runoff, colour = STATION_NAME)) +   labs(y = "Mean daily runoff [mm/d]") +   scale_colour_viridis_d(option = "C") +   theme_minimal() +   theme(legend.position = "bottom")

text: Evaluate current conditions station Nunavut longest record also Reference Hydrometric Basin Network relative historical values. second example, illustrate calculate common metric used hydrology: percentiles. approach use another piped series functions zero station want. packages need example loaded first: pipe finds active station realtime data Reference Hydrometric Basin Network (RHBN) territory Nunavut longest record grabs daily flow information: can now evaluate historical distribution data collection put real time data historical context. First need calculate individual observation distributed observations day every day. prctile column tells us percentage values day entire data record fall observations row. restricting analysis last thirty days vignette last compiled. ecdf() function creates equation calculate percentiles based Value column (.e discharge) takes individual observation Value calculates percentile. collect real time data, can use realtime_dd() function tidyhydat. real time data collected hourly (higher) intervals operating daily basis, first need take daily mean discharge. accomplished pipe: Finally can plot one figure. type plot useful combine historical data sources real time data provide visual assessment typical flows given system . CAUTION: real time data presented represents unapproved data.
code: library(tidyhydat) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(lubridate) nunavut_stn_flows <- hy_stations() %>%   filter(HYD_STATUS == "ACTIVE") %>%   filter(REAL_TIME == TRUE) %>%   filter(RHBN == TRUE) %>%   filter(PROV_TERR_STATE_LOC == "NU") %>%   pull_station_number() %>%   hy_stn_data_range() %>%   filter(DATA_TYPE == "Q") %>%    filter(RECORD_LENGTH == max(RECORD_LENGTH)) %>%   pull_station_number() %>%   hy_daily_flows() pct_flow <- nunavut_stn_flows %>%   mutate(dayofyear = yday(Date), Year = year(Date)) %>%   filter(dayofyear %in% yday(seq.Date(from = (Sys.Date()-30),                                        to = Sys.Date(), by = "day"))) %>%   group_by(dayofyear) %>%   mutate(prctile = ecdf(Value)(Value)) %>%   mutate(Date_no_year = dmy(paste0(day(Date),"-",month(Date),"-",year(Sys.Date())))) %>%   ungroup() nunavut_realtime <- realtime_dd(unique(nunavut_stn_flows$STATION_NUMBER)) %>%      mutate(Date_day = as.Date(Date)) %>%      group_by(Date_day) %>%      summarise(Value = mean(Value, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop") ggplot(pct_flow, aes(x = Date_no_year, y = Value)) +   geom_point(aes(colour = prctile)) +   geom_line(data = nunavut_realtime, aes(x = Date_day), colour = "black") +   geom_point(data = nunavut_realtime, aes(x = Date_day, shape = factor(year(Date_day))), colour = "black") +   scale_colour_viridis_c(name = "Discharge Percentile") +   scale_shape_discrete(name = "Year") +   theme_minimal() +   labs(title = "Historical flow relative to current year",        subtitle = "Current year flows are displayed in black",        caption = "Real time data is presents AS IS and represents unapproved data",        x = "Date", y = "Discharge (m^3/s)")

title: Extract and Tidy Canadian Hydrometric Data
text: tidyhydat provides two methods download realtime data. realtime_dd() provides function import .csv files . realtime_ws() client web service hosted ECCC. realtime_ws() several difference realtime_dd(). include: Speed: realtime_ws() much faster larger queries (.e. many stations). single station queries realtime_dd() appropriate. Length record: realtime_ws() records goes back time. Type parameters: realtime_dd() restricted river flow (either flow level) data. contrast realtime_ws() can download several different parameters depending available station. See data("param_id") list explanation parameters. Date/Time filtering: realtime_ws() provides argument select date range. Selecting data range realtime_dd() possible files downloaded.

title: Extract and Tidy Canadian Hydrometric Data
text: Plot methods also provided quickly visualize realtime data:  also historical data:
code: realtime_ex <- realtime_dd(station_number = "08MF005")  plot(realtime_ex) hy_ex <- hy_daily_flows(station_number = "08MF005", start_date = "2013-01-01")  plot(hy_ex)
